title: How to tell if my phone has 5G - Quora

response.answer_text: You will see a 5G logo on the back of the phone.. they do this so people can easily tell if it is a 5G phone or not: Galaxy S10 5G Version (Verizon):   LG V50 with 5G (Sprint)   Motorola 5G Mod Attachment Upgrade:  *Note: some 5G phones released more recently in 2020 may not have a 5G logo on the back anymore or have a 5G wallpaper.. so you may need to check the model of the phone and look at the specs online to know if it has 5G. The newer LG V60 and Samsung Galaxy S20 do not have 5G logos anymore:   Download Speed Test on your phone (free on Google Play app store). First disconnect WiFi and connect to mobile data. If you have 5G, your internet speeds will be crazy FAST as shown below:    Your phone probably doesn't have 5G most likely, you need to buy a phone that has 5G capability built in.. it CAN'T be installed or updated through a “software update” (with the exception of the Motorola Moto Mods 5G attachment accessory which you physically attach to the back of the phone). Most likely, a “5G” logo will be shown on the back of the phone to differentiate it from others and maybe a stock wallpaper photo on the phone showing a 5G background wallpaper or a 5G bootup logo splash screen (but like I said, some phones may not have a 5G logo on them so you'll need to check online for the specs). Another thing, 5G phones will have a very steep price tag.. so you'd know if you bought a 5G phone. Verizon is selling the Samsung 5G version of the Galaxy S10 phone for $1299.. so if you payed that much, you would know what it is capable of and what you're paying for. The LG V60 has 5G and the price is between $800–$900 (The LG V50 with 5G was like $1000)… Not too bad but still expensive. Here's a list of 5G phones available and where you can get them: 5G Phones: Every Known Phone and Release Date Note: AT&T is trying to trick people with a FAKE “5G E” logo which is NOT actually 5G but an improved version of 4G LTE… so don't be fooled. And also, you need to make sure your location where you live has 5G support.. 5G may not be available everywhere just yet.. only big major cities. FAKE 5G if you see it says “5G E” on AT&T:   How to turn off 5G (if you have it): If you buy a 5G phone but you DON'T want to use 5G, you can actually turn it OFF. On Android, just go to your "settings", select "network", then select "mobile data".. then press the menu button and select "mobile networks".. then select "network mode" and change the preferred network mode. Here you can change between 2G/3G, 4G LTE, and 5G. Why have 5G? Why not? App downloads will be instantaneous.. social media video uploads will be instantaneous.. HD 4K video streaming or downloading will not take long.. zoom conference video calls will not lag or buffer.. YouTube videos will always play videos at high definition instead of downgrading the resolution.. If you work in the hospital, government, or do business work on your phone, time is always essential and important.. so faster internet speeds means less time wasted and more extra free time to spare and get more things done. Why people are paranoid about 5G? There have been right wing conspiracy theorists that spreaded misinformation on YouTube.. YouTube took those videos down but it was already too late and the rumors already spread. Now there are certain people that think 5G is deadly or dangerous.. yet funny enough, they don't realize that FM radio emits more radiation than 5G. People have the tendency to beleive conspiracies or rumors at a much faster and higher rate than actual facts or science. Does Apple have 5G on their iPhones? NO, currently, Apple does not have any 5G capable phone.. the recent iPhone 11 Pro and Pro Max do not have 5G, they are only 4G LTE. Maybe in the future, Apple will release a 5G phone.

There are very few smartphones that have 5G support. Regardless of what you hear the naysayers lying about, 5G is nationwide in the US as we speak. T-Mobile just launched the first true nationwide deployment of 5G using the low-band 600MHz spectrum. This is the first type of 5G. The second type, known as mid-band sub-6GHz has been launched by Sprint in select cities throughout the country. The third type and the fastest, high-band mmWave, has been launched by Verizon and AT&T in select US cities as well. It is confirmed to be over ten times faster than LTE Advanced, but has a small footprint as its disadvantage, meaning the signal doesn't travel far. Carriers are actively working on solutions to broaden the infrastructure of mmWave 5G. So in the US, we won't be waiting ten years for 5G. We won't be waiting ten minutes. All four major carriers have launched 5G and subscribers with 5G supported devices are using it as we speak. That's a fact. To your original question, how do you know if your phone has 5G? Believe me when I say, if your device supported 5G you would know because the 5G nomenclature would be included in the name of your device (e.g. Samsung Galaxy Tab S6 5G, Galaxy S10 Plus 5G, etc.).

Image : Credit 5G has not yet been launched commercially and in the testing phase. So it is unlikely that you will have a phone that supports 5G. Moreover, there is hardly any phone in the market that supports 5G at present. Obviously, in the coming years, we will see mobile phones with 5G technology and they will display 5G on the signal bar and let you know that it is a 5G enabled handset. Moreover, you will get the option of switching between 4G or 5G depending upon your preference and network availability. But as of the present scenario, your phone is most likely not to have 5G because the industry is still not fully prepared for 5G and waiting for commercial launch. Moreover, you will need to change your existing mobile phone and buy a new one in order to experience true 5G speed because your old phone will only support up to 4G.  Hope it helps! OKportal Technology

Android phone settings Another easier way to tell if your smartphone supports 5G or not is to check in the phone settings. Assuming it’s an Android phone, tap on Settings >> Network & internet >> Mobile Network >> Preferred Network type. You should see all the Mobile Network technologies supported such as 2G, 3G, 4G, and 5G. If 5G is listed, then your phone supports it.  Oppo Reno 5G settings Top list of 5G smartphones in 2020 The list of 5G Smartphones is growing every year. We can’t practically list every device here, but I’ll list the popular smartphones as of 2020 that have 5G support so far. Samsung Galaxy S20 seriesSamsung Galaxy Note 10 5G / Plus 5GSamsung Galaxy A71 5GOnePlus 8 seriesOnePlus NordLG V60 ThinQSony Xperia 1 IIOppo Find X2 ProXiaomi Mi 10 seriesRealme X50 Pro 5GHuawei Mate 30 Pro 5GVivo IQoo 3 5GRedmi K30 5G This list is going to be increasing over the coming months. Before you purchase a pricey 5G smartphone, first check if your Mobile network operator has a 5G network in the first place, otherwise, 5G will be a redundant feature.

Unless you bought a 5G phone it won’t get the signal. It may identify that the signal is there. That’s bait. Nothing is given away. Apple, Samsung, the phone makers need to keep the built in obsolescence going. The telecoms need you to pay more to keep profits coming in. They want you to upgrade for faster downloads. 5G is a radar technology. It’s revolutionary and its deadly fast if you don’t mind being on the receiving end of a focused steerable radar beam. Someone has got to try it out. It is all about tracking. The telecoms need data to sell. They would love to track you and have you pay for it with your upgraded dead fast handset.

So, 5G is the next hot thing, promising faster speeds for wireless data and all the carriers are hyping it, even though most don’t have much 5G technology deployed in their networks. There are two components to 5G - does your wireless carrier support it where you are? And did you just buy a brand new 5G capable smartphone (I believe only Samsung offers them so far) in the last few months? You can call your wireless carrier and ask where they have 5G - or maybe they have a coverage map online. You can look up the make and model number of your smartphone to see if it is 5G capable.

Look at the top right corner if it says 5g it's getting 5g but att has 5ge and it's not true 5g it's basically a more advanced 4g LTE connection but it's not much better than 4g LTE really cause I had that 5ge from att and I swear it seemed slower than dial up. I'm with Verizon better signal better service and with my Verizon plan I have a year of Disney plus for free and free Apple music too

Is it an iPhone? Then no.Was it bought in the first half of 2019 or earler? Then no.Was it bought in the second half of 2019 and is the top of the line Samsung or LG? Then maybe.Or, is it on your carriers list of actual 5G devices? Then yes.

Real 5G isn’t going to arrive in the States for ten years. A complete changeover of technology that only the government is rich enough to provide, is necessary for genuine 5G. Big Cell is pretending it has 5G, but they don’t really and can’t provide Real 5G soon. Cell towers will still exist, but 5G will require enormous mouse pad shaped antennas mounted on nearly every utility pole in the country and an enormous load more of technology behind it, to bring 5G off. Parts of China and parts of South Korea are hosting 5G now. It is an enormous undertaking that will require powerful wifi everywhere to bring off.

Most ‘new’ phones that come out, have heavily marketed 5g so you'll know if you have one. If you still don't you probably don't have it. In the current state of 5g it's not a great step up from 4g, that is if you don't live in an area that has great mm wave coverage.

It you bought it before you posted this question and it is a Iphone or Samsung, then it isnt a 5G ready phone. Unless it is a Huawei's phone Mate 30 and the new Samsung S10 5G(no released yet). Otherwise you are still on 4G/LTE..it needs a new modem in your phone that is 5G ready in order to be a 5G phone..anything else is just an imitation and a marketing scheme.

Q: How can I tell if my phone has 5G? There are three things to check: The specification of the phone.The type of SIM.Whether you are in a location that has 5G services on your network.Only if all these three support 5G operation can the phone has a 5G service.
5G is relatively new in the Smartphone world so at this point every phone that supports it will likely have a huge 5G badge right on the back or somewhere on the phone to let you know it supports 5G

A2A: You bought it very recently and the vendor made a big deal about the fact that it has 5G. You would also have paid a very high price. If it is an AT&T phone and you see a “5G E” logo, ignore that. It is a misleading claim about regular old 4G. (They’ve been sued about it.)

response.answer_text: That's actually easy. It only has 5G capabilities if you bought the 5G version. So if it's more than a year old and you didn't buy the specific 5G version (you would of known as it would of been all over the box) than it NOT 5G.
The obvious answers are read the specs Or read the articles out there on the phones that are already https://www.t3.com/news/best-5g-phones
If your phone isn’t one of these, it doesn’t have 5G. If you have an iPhone of any kind, it doesn’t support 5G. List of All 5G Network Supported Mobile Phones in 2019
Look for specifications of the model on Google. Type the device name + Specifications. A list will come up and you will find it.

If you bought it within the last 6 months and you paid a lot of money for it. Lol. There are only a few phones that are already out that support it. S10 5G, OnePlus 7 Pro, Moto z4, note 105G, LG V50 ThinQ, and I believe there is something you can add to the z3 and z4 to make it 5g capable
